required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Game Changers
clinical_study.official_title: Controlled Trial of Game Changers: A Group Intervention to Train HIV Clients to be Change Agents for HIV Prevention in Uganda

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a randomized controlled trial (RCT) of Game Changers, an 8-session peer-led group intervention that aims to empower and mobilize people living with HIV (PLWH) to be agents for HIV prevention in their social networks.

detailed_description.textblock: This RCT of Game Changers, a peer-led group intervention for persons living with HIV (PLWH) in Uganda, will test intervention effects on the primary outcomes of reduced condomless sex, increased HIV testing, and decreased enacted HIV stigma among social network members. We will recruit 210 PLWH, randomizing 105 to the intervention and 105 to an attention control. Each PLWH will be asked to recruit up to 4 social network members to complete assessments (736 total, 368/arm). All participants will complete surveys at baseline and 6-, 12-, and 18-months post-baseline.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Individual randomization to one of two parallel groups, the intervention or usual care (no intervention) control group.
study_design_info.masking_description: The assessment interviewer will be blinded to study arm allocation of the participants at baseline only.

primary_outcome.description: Self-reported HIV testing behavior by social network members (yes/no)
Self-reported consistent condom use during intercourse by social network members (always vs sometime/never)

secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported internalized HIV stigma among people living with HIV (on 1-5 scale)
Self-reported prevention advocacy among people living with HIV (on 1-5 scale)

arm_group.description: 8-session group intervention to train participants to engage in HIV prevention advocacy.
Participants will receive HIV usual care, and no added intervention.

intervention.description: 8-session group intervention that uses didactic instruction, role plays and experience sharing to empower participants to engage in HIV prevention advocacy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18 years and older
- HIV-positive
- in HIV care at The Infectious DIseases Institute for at least one year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participated in the prior pilot study of the intervention.

patient_data.ipd_description: A de-identified dataset will be made available upon review of requests from outside researchers
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Following publication of primary results of the study (approximately August 2026).
